content.description: Ledges Classic! Most likely the best route at the Ledges. This route climbs to a good ledge then a few thin face moves to the roof crux.
content.location: This route is located on the cleanest part of the wall and climbs up and over the obvious small roof as shown in the photo it is the green route.

content.description: This route starts up easy face moves to a ledge and then angles left and up to the anchors. Keep in mind it can be green at times so brushing this one before leading might be a good idea.
content.location: This route is located to the left of Underwater Bears and is the red route in the photo

content.description: This route is a little tricky getting off the ground but once off follow the thin layback up to some good holds and the anchors
content.location: This route is located about 5 feet to the left of Santa Clause and is the Blue route in the photo

content.description: This route starts with a few thin on layback movie to some good holds than a few more thin layback moves to the anchors
content.location: This route is located about 5 feet to the left of No Balls allowed

content.description: .This route start with a few thin moves to a crux-y layback to a jug and good holds
content.location: This route is located to the Left of Rabies and climbs pass four bolts to anchors

content.description: This route climbs a thin face up to some good pockets and a long reach to a small crimp / flake followed by a tech-y move to good but at time dirty holds to the anchors.
content.location: This route is located just to the left of Underwater Bears and is likely the 2nd best route at the Ledges.  This climb is the Yellow route in the Photo.

content.description: Sport routes on a short wall
